title: Business & Finance
text:
Walgreens Boots named Starbucks operating chief Rosalind Brewer as its next CEO, making her the only Black woman leading a Fortune 500 company.

---

J&J said it expects to report pivotal results of a large clinical trial of its Covid-19 vaccine by early next week, as the company posted improved quarterly sales.

---

GE booked $4.4 billion in fourth-quarter cash flow, beating its own projection and ending 2020 without burning cash, a year ahead of schedule.

---

Goldman slashed CEO Solomon's 2020 pay by 36%, punishment for the bank's admission last year that it broke U.S. laws in its dealings with 1MDB.

---

PepsiCo plans a joint venture with imitation-meat maker Beyond Meat to develop snacks and drinks made from plant-based protein.

---

U.S. stocks fell, with the S&P 500 retreating 0.2% and the Dow and Nasdaq both slipping 0.1%.

---

Warner Music is close to agreeing to buy a minority stake in Saudi billionaire Prince al-Waleed bin Talal's Rotana Music.

---

Private-equity giant Blackstone agreed to purchase Allstate Life Insurance Co. from Allstate Corp . for $2.8 billion.
